projects.title: X-Lights
projects.description:
X-Lights is probably my largest programming project, it combines a variety of technologies to create an unique LED controller. Sound's simple, and to be honest, it is, but a lot of simplicity brings complexity. With X-Lights (to be renamed) you can control multiple LED strips all over the world. You can synchronize them, or let them all play their own unique show. X-Lights also supports sensors as inputs - you could use a light sensor to turn on your lights when it's dark, or let them glow red when your room has a certain temperature. As a programmer you can also easily create new light modes and extend existing functionality.

X-Lights consists of:

  • A NodeJS Server running a websocket
  • A Vue.js webapp to control the lights
  • A Wemos D1 Mini microcontroller
  • A small C# client that analyzes music

Here's a little DemoGitHub Repo

projects.title: Spacepilot
projects.description: Spacepilot is a game for android smartphones. It's made with Monogame for C#. You play as an pilot of a spaceship, and your objective is to destroy enemy fighters. Really simple, but highly addictive ;) Can you be the hero who saves the world from these evil guys? The project will be uploaded to my GitHub account soon, stay tuned!

projects.title: Liquicalc
projects.description: LiquiCalc was my first project that's realised in Flutter with Google's Dart programming language. Flutter is a framework created to design Android and IOS apps easily. With LiquiCalc you can create awesome aroma recipes for your e-liquids! It includes a wide variety of pre-existing recipes, but you can also add your own ones. You're able to share created recipes with friends and the community. The project will be uploaded to my GitHub account soon, stay tuned!

projects.title: BetterKLM
projects.description: BetterKLM is a C# application made for controlling the led keyboard of the MSI GE60 Apache gaming laptop. The existing keyboard light manager misses some features I really wanted to have, so I built my own small application.
